thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: French finmin says market sell-off an expected "correction"

title: French finmin says market sell-off an expected "correction"
text:
February 6, 2018 / 4:26 PM / in a few seconds French finance minister says market sell-off an expected 'correction' Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
PARIS (Reuters) - French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire on Tuesday said a global market sell-off was an expected correction of high asset prices. 
Asked if he was worried as world stock markets nosedived for a fourth day running on Tuesday, Le Maire told reporters: 
“It’s not a surprise. Some assets had reached very high prices and there is therefore a correction on stock markets.” 
“At the last IMF (International Monetary Fund) meeting in Washington several people, including me, had said that asset prices, as well as the abundance of liquidity, were a concern. So a correction was something to be expected.” Reporting by Ingrid Melander; editing by Michel Rose
